content: linen stitch dishcloth pattern by liz alvino why make dishcloths i designed this pattern to help support www eachstitchcounts org the mission of each stitch counts is to alleviate hygiene insecurity by providing food pantries with dish and laundry detergent containers of dish detergent include a handmade dishcloth donated by crafter volunteers households dealing with food insecurity often deal with hygiene insecurity we reach this community by supplying these products please consider making some dishcloths and donating them with a bottle of dish soap to a food pantry near you however each stitch counts gladly accepts donations of your handiwork and will distribute them with a bottle of soap please ship your dishcloths to usps ups or fedex each stitch counts 1358 hooper ave - pmb 125 toms river nj 08753 1 linen dishcloth by liz alvino materials abbreviations finished dimensions medium weight/dk or chain- chain your finished dishcloth worsted weight cotton yarn should be 8 x 8 100-120yds single_crochet- single_crochet if it s a little bigger or 6 5/k hook space- space smaller don t worry if it s not a perfect square don t scissors st- stitch worry all dishcloths donated are appreciated tapestry needle slip_stitch- slip_stitch however they turn out thank you for taking the bottle of dish soap if you time to do something for plan to donate locally others dishcloth pattern foundation chain 30 if using a different size hook or different weight yarn chain an even amount of stitches for 9 1/2 once you start to work the pattern of this dishcloth it should shrink down to 8 after the 2nd row *note i suggest working row 1 in the back bump of the foundation chain if you don t know how or don t like to do that no problem * row 1 single_crochet in the back bump of the 2nd chain from hook and each st until the end chain 2 turn 29 stitches you should now have an odd number of stitches row 2 single_crochet in 1st st *ch1 skip 1 stitch single_crochet in next stitch repeat from * to end ending with single_crochet in last stitch chain 3 turn 14 chain 1 spaces + ch3 space at the end row 3 single_crochet in first ch1 space *ch1 single_crochet in next ch1 space repeat from * to end ending with a single_crochet in beginning ch3 space from the previous row ch3 turn 14 chain 1 spaces + ch3 space at the end repeat row 3 until the dishcloth measures 8 about 29 row when you get to your final corner chain 12 and slip_stitch back to the last stitch of the row to make a loop to hang your cloth from tie your dishcloth to a new bottle of dish soap and drop it off at any food pantry in your area if you have any questions about the pattern please reach out via instagram @arrowacresfarmyarn or by email lalvino913@gmail com 2 linen dishcloth by liz alvino
